checkrule_set.description: Access of forwarded variable 'v'.
Access of moved variable 'v'.
Buffer 'buffer' is too small, the function 'function' expects a bigger buffer in 2nd argument
'varname' is of type 'vartype'. When using void pointers in calculations, the behaviour is undefined.
Array 'arr[16]' accessed at index 16, which is out of bounds.
Array 'arr[16]' accessed at index 16, which is out of bounds.
Array index 'i' is used before limits check.
Assert statement calls a function which may have desired side effects: 'function'.
Boolean value assigned to floating point variable.
Boolean value assigned to pointer.
Mismatching assignment and comparison, comparison '' is always false.
Assigning a pointer to an integer is not portable.
Assert statement modifies 'var'.
Suspicious assignment in condition. Condition 'x=y' is always true.
Assigning an integer to a pointer is not portable.
Address of local auto-variable assigned to a function parameter.
Deallocation of an auto-variable results in undefined behaviour.
Result of operator '|' is always true if one operand is non-zero. Did you intend to use '&'?
Boolean expression 'expression' is used in bitwise operation. Did you mean '&&'?
BOOST_FOREACH caches the end() iterator. It's undefined behavior if you modify the container inside.
Buffer is accessed out of bounds: buf
Returning an address value in a function with integer return type is not portable.
Returning an integer in a function with pointer return type is not portable.
Exception should be caught by reference.
When using 'char' variables in bit operations, sign extension can generate unexpected results.
Char literal compared with pointer 'foo'. Did you intend to dereference it?
Storing func_name() return value in char variable and then comparing with EOF.
Clarify calculation precedence for '+' and '?'.
Suspicious condition (assignment + comparison); Clarify expression with parentheses.
In expression like '*A++' the result of '*' is unused. Did you intend to write '(*A)++;'?
Comma is used in return statement. The comma can easily be misread as a ';'.
Comparison of a boolean expression with an integer other than 0 or 1.
Comparing pointers that point to different objects
Comparing expression of type 'unsigned char' against value 256. Condition is always true.
Expression '(X & 0x6) == 0x1' is always false.
Comparison of two identical variables with isless(varName,varName) always evaluates to false.
Comparison of a variable having boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
Comparison of a boolean value using relational operator (<, >, <= or >=).
Comparison of a function returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
Comparison of two functions returning boolean value using relational (<, >, <= or >=) operator.
Skipping configuration 'X' since the value of 'X' is unknown. Use -D if you want to check it. You can use -U to skip it explicitly.
Redundant code: Found a statement that begins with type constant.
Variable 'x' can be declared with const
Out of bounds access in expression 'container[x]'
The class 'class' has 'operator=' but lack of 'copy constructor'.
Value of pointer 'var', which points to allocated memory, is copied in copy constructor instead of allocating new memory.
Invalid usage of output stream: '<< std::cout'.
C-style pointer casting
Non-local variable 'x' will use object.
Non-local reference variable 'x' to local variable 'y'
Using object to temporary.
Using reference to dangling temporary.
Deallocating a deallocated pointer: varname
Returning/dereferencing 'p' after it is deallocated / released
Dereferencing 'varname' after it is deallocated / released
Possible dereference of an invalid iterator: i
Division of result of sizeof() on pointer type.
Memory pointed to by 'varname' is freed twice.
Same expression used in consecutive assignments of 'x' and 'x'.
Found duplicate branches for 'if' and 'else'.
Consecutive return, break, continue, goto or throw statements are unnecessary.
The if condition is the same as the previous if condition
Duplicate expression for the condition and assignment.
Same expression on both sides of '&&'.
Same expression in both branches of ternary operator.
Same value in both branches of ternary operator.
The class 'class' defines member variable with name 'variable' also defined in its parent class 'class'.
Invalid iterator 'iter' used.
Exception thrown in invalid state, 'p' points at deallocated memory.
Throwing a copy of the caught exception instead of rethrowing the original exception.
Class Class is not safe, destructor throws exception
fflush() called on input stream 'stdin' may result in undefined behaviour on non-linux systems.
Undefined behaviour: float (1e+100) to integer conversion overflow.
Function 'function' argument 2 names different: declaration 'A' definition 'B'.
Function 'function' argument order different: declaration '' definition ''
Technically the member function 'class::function' can be const.
Technically the member function 'class::function' can be static (but you may consider moving to unnamed namespace).
Lock guard is defined globally. Lock guards are intended to be local. A global lock guard could lead to a deadlock since it won't unlock until the end of the program.
Identical condition 'x', second condition is always false
Identical inner 'if' condition is always true.
Return value of function malloc() is not used.
The file 'tmp' is opened for read and write access at the same time on different streams
Array 'buffer' is filled incompletely. Did you forget to multiply the size given to 'memset()' with 'sizeof(*buffer)'?
Conversion of char literal 'x' to bool always evaluates to true.
Logical disjunction always evaluates to true: foo > 3 && foo < 4.
Conversion of string literal "Hello World" to bool always evaluates to true.
String literal "Hello World" doesn't match length argument for substr().
Incrementing a variable of type 'bool' with postfix operator++ is deprecated by the C++ Standard. You should assign it the value 'true' instead.
Member variable 'class::variable' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
Signed integer overflow for expression ''.
Using object that may be invalid.
Calling 'erase' while iterating the container is invalid.
Mismatching address is freed. The address you get from malloc() must be freed without offset.
Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. The value is 0 or 1 (boolean) but the valid values are '1:4'.
Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. A non-boolean value is required.
Invalid func_name() argument nr 1. A nul-terminated string is required.
Invalid iterator: iterator
'I' in format string (no. 1) is a length modifier and cannot be used without a conversion specifier.
Using object that is out of scope.
Casting between float * and double * which have an incompatible binary data representation.
%f in format string (no. 1) requires 'double' but the argument type is Unknown.
%n in format string (no. 1) requires 'int *' but the argument type is Unknown.
%p in format string (no. 1) requires an address but the argument type is Unknown.
%s in format string (no. 1) requires 'char *' but the argument type is Unknown.
%i in format string (no. 1) requires 'int' but the argument type is Unknown.
%u in format string (no. 1) requires 'unsigned int' but the argument type is Unknown.
scanf() without field width limits can crash with huge input data.
%f in format string (no. 1) requires 'float *' but the argument type is Unknown.
%d in format string (no. 1) requires 'int *' but the argument type is Unknown.
%s in format string (no. 1) requires a 'char *' but the argument type is Unknown.
Width 5 given in format string (no. 10) is larger than destination buffer '[0]', use %-1s to prevent overflowing it.
Width -1 given in format string (no. 99) is smaller than destination buffer '[0]'.
Invalid test for overflow 'x + c < x'; signed integer overflow is undefined behavior. Some mainstream compilers remove such overflow tests when optimising the code and assume it's always false.
Read and write operations without a call to a positioning function (fseek, fsetpos or rewind) or fflush in between result in undefined behaviour.
Same iterator is used with different containers 'container1' and 'container2'.
Same iterator is used with different containers 'container0' and 'container1'.
Same iterator is used with containers 'container' that are defined in different scopes.
Argument 'x-x' to function 'func' is always 0. It does not matter what value 'x' has.
Argument 'x*0' to function 'func' is always 0. Constant literal calculation disable/hide variable expression 'x'.
Condition 'x' is always false
Iterating over container 'var' that is always empty.
Allocation with funcName, funcName doesn't release it.
Return value of allocation function 'funcName' is not stored.
Unsafe allocation. If funcName() throws, memory could be leaked. Use make_shared<int>() instead.
String literal compared with variable 'foo'. Did you intend to use strcmp() instead?
The lock is ineffective because the mutex is locked at the same scope as the mutex itself.
Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class contains a std::string.
Memory for class instance allocated with malloc(), but class provides constructors.
Memory leak: varname
Common realloc mistake: 'varname' nulled but not freed upon failure
Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a classname.
Using memset() on class which contains a floating point number.
Using 'memfunc' on class that contains a reference.
The 2nd memset() argument 'varname' is a float, its representation is implementation defined.
The 2nd memset() argument 'varname' doesn't fit into an 'unsigned char'.
memset() called to fill 0 bytes.
Mismatching allocation and deallocation: varname
Mismatching bitmasks. Result is always 0 (X = Y & 0xf0; Z = X & 0x1; => Z=0).
Iterators to containers from different expressions 'v1' and 'v2' are used together.
Iterator 'it' from different container 'v1' are used together.
Iterators of different containers 'v1' and 'v2' are used together.
The allocated size sz is not a multiple of the underlying type's size.
Include file: "" not found.
Include file: <> not found. Please note: Cppcheck does not need standard library headers to get proper results.
The function '' overrides a function in a base class but is not marked with a 'override' specifier.
Found a exit path from function with non-void return type that has missing return statement
Comparison of modulo result is predetermined, because it is always less than 1.
Modulo of one is always equal to zero
Expression is always false because 'else if' condition matches previous condition at line 1.
Multiplying sizeof() with sizeof() indicates a logic error.
Using NaN/Inf in a computation.
Array index -1 is out of bounds.
Negative array index
The class 'classname' does not have a constructor although it has private member variables.
Class 'class' does not have a copy constructor which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).
Class 'class' does not have a destructor which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).
Class 'classname' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.
Class 'class' does not have a operator= which is recommended since it has dynamic memory/resource allocation(s).
Null pointer dereference
Pointer arithmetic with NULL pointer.
Either the condition is redundant or there is pointer arithmetic with NULL pointer.
Possible null pointer dereference if the default parameter value is used: pointer
Either the condition is redundant or there is possible null pointer dereference: pointer.
The address of local variable '' is accessed at non-zero index.
No 'return' statement in non-void function causes undefined behavior.
'operator=' should return reference to 'this' instance.
'operator=' should either return reference to 'this' instance or be declared private and left unimplemented.
'operator=' should check for assignment to self to avoid problems with dynamic memory.
Member variable 'classname::' is not assigned a value in 'classname::operator='.
Opposite expression on both sides of '&&'.
Opposite inner 'if' condition leads to a dead code block.
The expression 'strcmp(x,"def") != 0' is suspicious. It overlaps 'strcmp(x,"abc") == 0'.
Overlapping read/write in () is undefined behavior
Overlapping read/write of union is undefined behavior
Function parameter 'parametername' should be passed by const reference.
Comparison is wrong. Result of 'ptr+1' can't be 0 unless there is pointer overflow, and pointer overflow is undefined behaviour.
Converting pointer arithmetic result to bool. The bool is always true unless there is undefined behaviour.
A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is.
Pointer arithmetic overflow.
A pointer can not be negative so it is either pointless or an error to check if it is not.
Size of pointer 'varname' used instead of size of its data.
Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
#error message
Possible leak in public function. The pointer 'varname' is not deallocated before it is allocated.
Call of pure virtual function 'f' in constructor.
The configuration '' was not checked because its code equals another one.
Race condition: non-interlocked access after InterlockedDecrement(). Use InterlockedDecrement() return value instead.
Reading from empty STL container 'var'
Read operation on a file that was opened only for writing.
Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used. 'break;' missing?
Variable 'var' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.
Redundant bitwise operation on 'varname' in 'switch' statement. 'break;' missing?
Redundant condition: If x > 11 the condition x > 10 is always true.
Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used.
Buffer 'var' is being written before its old content has been used. 'break;' missing?
Use const reference for 'varname' to avoid unnecessary data copying.
Redundant checking of STL container element existence before removing it.
Redundant initialization for 'var'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.
Redundant pointer operation on 'varname' - it's already a pointer.
Resource leak: varname

Rethrowing current exception with 'throw;', it seems there is no current exception to rethrow. If there is no current exception this calls std::terminate(). More: https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/exceptions#throw-without-an-object
Address of an auto-variable returned.
Address of function parameter 'parameter' returned.
Returning object that will be invalid when returning.
Pointer to local array variable returned.
Non-boolean value returned from function returning bool
Reference to local variable returned.
Using std::move for returning object by-value from function will affect copy elision optimization. More: https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#Rf-return-move-local
Reference to temporary returned.
Same iterators expression are used for algorithm.
Repositioning operation performed on a file opened in append mode has no effect.
Redundant assignment of 'varname' to itself.
Member variable 'var' is initialized by itself.
Local variable 'argument' shadows outer argument
Local variable 'function' shadows outer function
Local variable 'variable' shadows outer variable
Shifting by a negative value is undefined behaviour
Shifting a negative value is technically undefined behaviour
Shifting 32-bit value by 40 bits is undefined behaviour
Shifting signed 32-bit value by 31 bits is implementation-defined behaviour
Expression 'var' can have a negative value. That is converted to an unsigned value and used in an unsigned calculation.
Signed 'char' type used as array index.
Found calculation inside sizeof().
'*varname' is of type 'void', the behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.
Division by result of sizeof(). memset() expects a size in bytes, did you intend to multiply instead?
Found function call inside sizeof().
Calling 'sizeof' on 'sizeof'.
Behaviour of 'sizeof(void)' is not covered by the ISO C standard.
Suspicious usage of 'sizeof' with a numeric constant as parameter.
Using 'sizeof' on array given as function argument returns size of a pointer.
Undefined behavior: Variable 'varname' is used as parameter and destination in s[n]printf().
Unnecessary comparison of static strings.
Dangerous comparison using operator< on iterator.
Dangerous usage of c_str(). The value returned by c_str() is invalid after this call.
Passing the result of c_str() to a function that takes std::string as argument no. 0 is slow and redundant.
Returning the result of c_str() in a function that returns std::string is slow and redundant.
Dangerous usage of c_str(). The value returned by c_str() is invalid after throwing exception.
Searching before insertion is not necessary.
Suspicious condition. The result of find() is an iterator, but it is not properly checked.
Inefficient usage of string::find() in condition; string::starts_with() could be faster.
Missing bounds check for extra iterator increment in loop.
When i==foo.size(), foo[i] is out of bounds.
Possible inefficient checking for 'list' emptiness.
Comparison of identical string variables.
Modifying string literal directly or indirectly is undefined behaviour.
Unusual pointer arithmetic. A value of type 'char' is added to a string literal.
Found suspicious case label in switch(). Operator '||' probably doesn't work as intended.
Suspicious use of ; at the end of '' statement.
Suspicious pointer subtraction. Did you intend to write '->'?
Using member 'x' when 'this' might be invalid
Exception thrown in function declared not to throw exceptions.
Too many #ifdef configurations - cppcheck only checks 12 configurations. Use --force to check all configurations. For more details, use --enable=information.
int result is assigned to long variable. If the variable is long to avoid loss of information, then you have loss of information.
int result is returned as long value. If the return value is long to avoid loss of information, then you have loss of information.
Variable 'varname' is not assigned a value.
Unhandled exception specification when calling function foo().
Memory is allocated but not initialized: varname
Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor. Maybe it should be initialized directly in the class classname?
Member variable 'classname::varnamepriv' is not initialized in the constructor. Maybe it should be initialized directly in the class classname?
Member variable 'classname::varname' is not initialized in the constructor.
Member variable 'classname::varnamepriv' is not initialized in the constructor.
Dangerous usage of 'varname' (strncpy doesn't always null-terminate it).
Uninitialized struct member: a.b
Uninitialized variable: varname
Expression 'x = x++;' depends on order of evaluation of side effects
'char' type used as array index.
Expression '1 - erf(x)' can be replaced by 'erfc(x)' to avoid loss of precision.
Statements following return, break, continue, goto or throw will never be executed.
Variable 'varname' is assigned a value that is never used.
Class 'class' is unsafe, 'class::varname' can leak by wrong usage.
Unsafe class: The const reference member 'UnsafeClass::var' is initialized by a const reference constructor argument. You need to be careful about lifetime issues.
Checking if unsigned expression 'varname' is less than zero.
Unsigned expression 'varname' can't be negative so it is unnecessary to test it.
Variable 'varname' is allocated memory that is never used.
The function 'funcName' is never used.
Label '' is not used.
Label '' is not used. There is #if in function body so the label might be used in code that is removed by the preprocessor.
Label '' is not used. Should this be a 'case' of the enclosing switch()?
Label '' is not used. There is #if in function body so the label might be used in code that is removed by the preprocessor. Should this be a 'case' of the enclosing switch()?
Unused private function: 'classname::funcname'
Instance of 'varname' object is destroyed immediately.
struct member 'structname::variable' is never used.
Unused variable: varname
Used file that is not opened.
Variable 'variable' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.
Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function. Did you forget dereferencing it?
It is inefficient to call 'str.find(str)' as it always returns 0.
Ineffective call of function 'empty()'. Did you intend to call 'clear()' instead?
Return value of std::remove() ignored. Elements remain in container.
Ineffective call of function 'substr' because it returns a copy of the object. Use operator= instead.
It is inefficient to swap a object with itself by calling 'str.swap(str)'
Consider using  algorithm instead of a raw loop.
Passing NULL after the last typed argument to a variadic function leads to undefined behaviour.
The scope of the variable 'varname' can be reduced.
va_list 'vl' was opened but not closed by va_end().
va_list 'vl' used before va_start() was called.
Using reference 'arg1' as parameter for va_start() results in undefined behaviour.
va_start() or va_copy() called subsequently on 'vl' without va_end() in between.
'arg1' given to va_start() is not last named argument of the function. Did you intend to pass 'arg2'?
Virtual function 'f' is called from constructor '' at line 1. Dynamic binding is not used.
Class 'Base' which is inherited by class 'Derived' does not have a virtual destructor.
Write operation on a file that was opened only for reading.
Passing value '#' to #() leads to implementation-defined result.
Buffer 'varname' must have size of 2 integers if used as parameter of pipe().
printf format string requires 3 parameters but only 2 are given.
printf: referencing parameter 2 while 1 arguments given
Division by zero.
Either the condition is redundant or there is division by zero.
Rule Required 1.1 The program shall contain no violations of the standard C syntax and constraints and shall not exceed the implementation's translation limits.
Rule Advisory 1.2 Language extensions should not be used.
Rule Required 1.3 There shall be no occurrence of undefined or critical unspecified behaviour.
Rule Required 1.4 Emergent language features shall not be used.
Rule Required 2.1 A project shall not contain unreachable code.
Rule Required 2.2 There shall be no dead code.
Rule Advisory 2.3 A project should not contain unused type declarations.
Rule Advisory 2.4 A project should not contain unused tag declarations.
Rule Advisory 2.5 A project should not contain unused macro declarations.
Rule Advisory 2.6 A function should not contain unused label declarations.
Rule Advisory 2.7 There should be no unused parameters in functions.
Rule Required 3.1 The character sequences /* and // shall not be used within a comment.
Rule Required 3.2 Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments.
Rule Required 4.1 Octal and hexadecimal escape sequences shall be terminated.
Rule Advisory 4.2 Trigraphs should not be used.
Rule Required 5.1 External identifiers shall be distinct.
Rule Required 5.2 Identifiers declared in the same scope and name space shall be distinct.
Rule Required 5.3 An identifier declared in an inner scope shall not hide an identifier declared in an outer scope.
Rule Required 5.4 Macro identifiers shall be distinct.
Rule Required 5.5 Identifiers shall be distinct from macro names.
Rule Required 5.6 A typedef name shall be a unique identifier.
Rule Required 5.7 A tag name shall be a unique identifier.
Rule Required 5.8 Identifiers that define objects or functions with external linkage shall be unique.
Rule Advisory 5.9 dentifiers that define objects or functions with internal linkage should be unique.
Rule Required 6.1 Bit-fields shall only be declared with an appropriate type.
Rule Required 6.2 Single-bit named bit fields shall not be of a signed type.
Rule Required 7.1 Octal constants shall not be used.
Rule Required 7.2 A "u" or "U" suffix shall be applied to all integer constants that are represented in an unsigned type.
Rule Required 7.3 The lowercase character 'l' shall not be used in a literal suffix.
Rule Required 7.4 A string literal shall not be assigned to an object unless the object's type is "pointer to const-qualified char".
Rule Required 8.1 Types shall be explicitly specified.
Rule Required 8.2 Function types shall be in prototype form with named parameters.
Rule Required 8.3 All declarations of an object or function shall use the same names and type qualifiers.
Rule Required 8.4 A compatible declaration shall be visible when an object or function with external linkage is defined.
Rule Required 8.5 An external object or function shall be declared once in one and only one file.
Rule Required 8.6 Rule Required 8.6 An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one external definition.
Rule Advisory 8.7 Rule Advisory 8.7 Functions and objects should not be defined with external linkage if they are referenced in only one.
Rule Required 8.8 Rule Required 8.8 The static storage class specifier shall be used in all declarations of objects and functions that have internal linkage.
Rule Advisory 8.9 Rule Advisory 8.9 An object should be defined at block scope if its identifier only appears in a single function.
Rule Required 8.10 Rule Required 8.10 An inline function shall be declared with the static storage class.
Rule Required 8.11 Rule Required 8.11 When an array with external linkage is declared its size should be explicitly specified.
Rule Required 8.12 Rule Required 8.12 Within an enumerator list the value of an implicitly-specified enumeration constant shall be unique.
Rule Advisory 8.13 Rule Advisory 8.13 A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.
Rule Required 8.14 Rule Required 8.14 The restrict type qualifier shall not be used.
Rule Mandatory 9.1 Rule Mandatory 9.1 The value of an object with automatic storage duration shall not be read before it has been set.
Rule Required 9.2 Rule Required 9.2 The initializer for an aggregate or union shall be enclosed in bracese.
Rule Required 9.3 Rule Required 9.3 Arrays shall not be partially initialized.
Rule Required 9.4 Rule Required 9.4 An element of an object shall not be initialised more than once.
Rule Required 9.5 Rule Required 9.5 Where designated initialisers are used to initialize an array object the size of the array shall be specified explicitly.
Rule Required 10.1 Rule Required 10.1 Operands shall not be of an inappropriate essential type.
Rule Required 10.2 Rule Required 10.2 Expressions of essentially character type shall not be used inappropriately in addition and.
Rule Required 10.3 Rule Required 10.3 The value of an expression shall not be assigned to an object with a narrower essential type or of a different essential type category.
Rule Required 10.4 Rule Required 10.4 Both operands of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed shall have the same essential type category.
Rule Advisory 10.5 Rule Advisory 10.5 The value of an expression should not be cast to an inappropriate essential type.
Rule Required 10.6 Rule Required 10.6 The value of a composite expression shall not be assigned to an object with wider essential type.
Rule Required 10.7 Rule Required 10.7 If a composite expression is used as one operand of an operator in which the usual arithmetic conversions are performed then the other operand.
Rule Required 10.8 Rule Required 10.8 The value of a composite expression shall not be cast to a different essential type category or a wider essential type.
Rule Required 11.1 Rule Required 11.1 Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to a function and any other type.
Rule Required 11.2 Rule 11.2 Required Conversions shall not be performed between a pointer to incomplete and any other type.
Rule Required 11.3 A cast shall not be performed between a pointer to object type and a pointer to a different object type.
Rule Advisory 11.4 A conversion should not be performed between a pointer to.
Rule Advisory 11.5 A conversion should not be performed from pointer to void into pointer to object.
Rule Required 11.6 A cast shall not be performed between pointer to void and an.
Rule Required 11.7 A cast shall not be performed between pointer to object and a non-integer arithmetic type.
Rule Required 11.8 A cast shall not remove any const or volatile qualification from the type.
Rule Required 11.9 The macro NULL shall be the only permitted form of integer null pointer constant.
Rule Advisory 12.1 The precedence of operators within expressions should be made explicit.(表达式中操作符的优先级应该明确。)
Rule Required 12.2 The right hand operand of a shift operator shall lie in the range zero to one less than the width in bits of the.
Rule Advisory 12.3 The comma operator should not be used.(不应该使用逗号操作符。)
Rule Advisory 12.4 Evaluation of constant expressions should not lead to unsigned integer.
Rule Required 13.1 Initialiser lists shall not contain persistent side effects.
Rule Required 13.2 The value of an expression and its persistent side effects shall be the same under all permitted evaluation orders.

Rule Advisory 13.3 A full expression containing an increment (++) or decrement (--) operator should have no other potential side effects other than that caused by the increment or decrement operator.(包含++或--的语句不应该有其他潜在的副作用。)
Rule Advisory 13.4 The result of an assignment operator should not be used.(不要使用赋值操作的结果，如if(a=2),也不要连续赋值，如a=b=c=2。)
Rule Required 13.5 The right hand operand of a logical && or || operator shall not contain persistent side effects.
Rule Mandatory 13.6 The operand of the sizeof operator shall not contain any expression which has potential side effects.
Rule Required 14.1 A loop counter shall not have essentially floating type.
Rule Required 14.2 A for loop shall be well-formed.
Rule Required 14.3 Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Rule Required 14.4 The controlling expression of an if statement and the controlling expression of an iteration-statement shall have essentially Boolean type.
Rule Advisory 15.1 The goto statement should not be used.
Rule Required 15.2 The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function.
Rule Required 15.3 Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block or in any block enclosing the goto statement.
Rule Advisory 15.4 There should be no more than one break or goto statement used to terminate any iteration statement.
Rule Advisory 15.5 A function should have a single point of exit at the end.(函数应该只有一个return的地方。)
Rule Required 15.6 The body of an iteration-statement or a selection-statement shall be a compound statement.
Rule Required 15.7 All if else if constructs shall be terminated with an else statement.
Rule Required 16.1 All switch statements shall be well-formed.
Rule Required 16.2 A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement.
Rule Required 16.3 An unconditional break statement shall terminate every switch-clause.
Rule Required 16.4 Every switch statement shall have a default label.
Rule Required 16.5 A default label shall appear as either the first or the last switch label of a switch statement.
Rule Required 16.6 Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses.
Rule Required 16.7 A switch-expression shall not have essentially Boolean type.
Rule Required 17.1 The features of <stdarg.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 17.2 Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.
Rule Mandatory 17.3 A function shall not be declared implicitly.
Rule Mandatory 17.4 All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression.
Rule Advisory 17.5 The function argument corresponding to a parameter declared to have an array type shall have an appropriate number of elements.
Rule Mandatory 17.6 The declaration of an array parameter shall not contain the static keyword between the [ ].
Rule Required 17.7 The value returned by a function having non-void return type shall be used.
Rule Advisory 17.8 A function parameter should not be modified.
Rule Required 18.1 A pointer resulting from arithmetic on a pointer operand shall address an element of the same array as that pointer operand.
Rule Required 18.2 Subtraction between pointers shall only be applied to pointers that address elements of the same array.
Rule Required 18.3 The relational operators '>'  '>='  '<' and '<=' shall not be applied to objects of pointer type except where they point into the same object.
Rule Advisory 18.4 The '+'  '-' '+=' and '-=' operators should not be applied to an expression of.
Rule Advisory 18.5 Declarations should contain no more than two levels of pointer nesting.
Rule Required 18.6 The address of an object with automatic storage shall not be copied to another object that persists after the first object has ceased to exist.
Rule Required 18.7 Flexible array members shall not be declared.
Rule Required 18.8 Variable-length array types shall not be used.
Rule Mandatory 19.1 An object shall not be assigned or copied to an overlapping object.
Rule Advisory 19.2 The union keyword should not be used.
Rule Advisory 20.1 #include directives should only be preceded by preprocessor directives or comments.
Rule Required 20.2 The ', " or \ characters and the /* or // character sequences shall not occur in a header file name.
Rule Required 20.3 The #include directive shall be followed by either a <filename> or "filename" sequence.
Rule Required 20.4 A macro shall not be defined with the same name as a keyword.
Rule Advisory 20.5 #undef should not be used.
Rule Required 20.6 Tokens that look like a preprocessing directive shall not occur within a macro argument.
Rule Required 20.7 Expressions resulting from the expansion of macro parameters shall.
Rule Required 20.8 The controlling expression of a #if or #elif preprocessing directive shall evaluate to 0 or 1.
Rule Required 20.9 All identifiers used in the controlling expression of #if or #elif preprocessing directives shall be #define'd before evaluation.
Rule Advisory 20.10 The # and ## preprocessor operators should not be used.
Rule Required 20.11 A macro parameter immediately following a # operator shall not immediately be followed by a ## operator.
Rule Required 20.12 A macro parameter used as an operand to the # or ## operators, which is itself subject to further macro replacement, shall only be used as an operand to these operators.
Rule Required 20.13 A line whose first token is # shall be a valid preprocessing directive.
Rule Required 20.14 All #else, #elif and #endif preprocessor directives shall reside in the same file as the #if, #ifdef or.
Rule Requirede 21.1 #define and #undef shall not be used on a reserved identifier or reserved macro name.
Rule Required 21.2 A reserved identifier or macro name shall not be declared.
Rule Required 21.3 The memory allocation and deallocation functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.4 The standard header file <setjmp.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.5 The standard header file <signal.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.6 The Standard Library input/output routines shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.7 The atof, atoi, atol and atoll functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.8 The library functions abort, exit, getenv and system of <stdlib.h>.
Rule Required 21.9 The library functions bsearch and qsort of <stdlib.h> shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.10 The Standard Library time and date routines shall not be used.
Rule Required 21.11 The standard header file <tgmath.h> shall not be used.
Rule Advisory 21.12 The exception handling features of <fenv.h> should not be used.
Rule Mandatory 21.13 Any value passed to a function in <ctype.h> shall be representable as an unsigned char or be the value EO
Rule Required 21.14 The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings
Rule Required 21.15 The pointer arguments to the Standard Library functions memcpy, memmove and memcmp shall be pointers to qualified or unqualified versions of compatible types

Rule Required 21.16 The pointer arguments to the Standard Library function memcmp shall point to either a pointer type, an essentially signed type, an essentially unsigned type, an essentially Boolean type or an essentially enum type
Rule Mandatory 21.17 Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters
Rule Mandatory 21.18 The size_t argument passed to any function in <string.h> shall have an appropriate value
Rule Mandatory 21.19 The pointers returned by the Standard Library functions localeconv, getenv, setlocale or, strerror shall only be used as if they have pointer to const-qualified type

Rule Mandatory 21.20 The pointer returned by the Standard Library functions asctime, ctime, gmtime, localtime, localeconv, getenv, setlocale or strerror shall not be used following a subsequent call to the same function
Rule Required 21.21 The Standard Library function system of shall not be used.
Rule Required 22.1 All resources obtained dynamically by means of Standard Library functions shall be explicitly released.
Rule Mandatory 22.2 A block of memory shall only be freed if it was allocated by means of a Standard Library function.
Rule Required 22.3 The same file shall not be open for read and write access at the same time on different streams.
Rule Mandatory 22.4 There shall be no attempt to write to a stream which has been opened as read-only
Rule Mandatory 22.5 A pointer to a FILE object shall not be dereferenced.
Rule Mandatory 22.6 The value of a pointer to a FILE shall not be used after the associated stream has been closed.
Rule Required 22.7 The macro EOF shall only be compared with the unmodified return value from any Standard Library function capable of returning EOF
Rule Required The value of errno shall be set to zero prior to a call to an errno-setting-function
Rule Required The value of errno shall be tested against zero after calling an errno-setting-function
Rule Required The value of errno shall only be tested when the last function to be called was an errno-setting-function
